questions.question: Why are you ………………… me like that?
questions.description: The verb look needs a preposition before its object.

questions.question: I would like you to ..................... this story.
questions.description: The verb listen needs the preposition to before its object.

questions.question: Let’s ………………. your plans.
questions.description: The verb talk requires a preposition before its object.

questions.question: Let’s …………………. your plans.
questions.description: The verb discuss does not take a preposition before its object.

questions.question: She ………………….. the station last night.
questions.description: Usually a preposition is necessary before an expression of place.

questions.question: I enjoy …………………. cards.
questions.description: The verb enjoy is followed by a noun or an ing form.

questions.question: I suggest …………………. an attorney.
questions.description: The verb suggest cannot be followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: The police believe ………………… to be dangerous.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object should be in its object form.

questions.question: I would like you to explain .......................
questions.description: The verb explain cannot be used with the structure indirect object + direct object.

questions.question: Can you suggest …………………?
questions.description: The verb suggest cannot be used with the structure indirect object + direct object.

questions.question: Please describe …………………
questions.description: The verb describe cannot be used with the structure indirect object + direct object.

questions.question: He fell ………………….
questions.description: Fell off is an inseparable phrasal verb.
